function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Poor nutrition and inadequate housing infrastructure heighten susceptibility to the pandemic within Indigenous communities.","Impact":"Increased risk of contagion and severe illness. Limited access to healthcare and resources.","Mitigation":"Improving access to nutritious food, clean water, and adequate housing. Strengthening healthcare infrastructure and support services.","Technologies":"Community health clinics, telemedicine, water treatment systems, housing construction technologies.","People":"Indigenous communities, especially those in remote areas.","Owner":"Health authorities, government agencies, community organizations."},{"Description":"High rates of crowding and inadequate access to water in Indigenous communities contribute to the difficulty of practicing social distancing and personal hygiene.","Impact":"Increased risk of disease transmission and limited ability to contain outbreaks.","Mitigation":"Building new housing infrastructure, improving water supply systems, and implementing education on hygiene practices.","Technologies":"Modern housing design, water purification systems, educational technology for hygiene promotion.","People":"Indigenous communities, especially those living in crowded conditions.","Owner":"Government housing authorities, community development organizations, public health agencies."},{"Description":"Increased risk of domestic violence due to housing and financial stress within Indigenous communities during the pandemic.","Impact":"Higher rates of domestic violence, mental health issues, and trauma. Limited access to support services.","Mitigation":"Providing safe shelters, counseling services, and financial support. Implementing community awareness campaigns on domestic violence prevention.","Technologies":"Safe shelter designs, tele-counseling platforms, financial assistance systems.","People":"Indigenous individuals and families experiencing housing and financial stress.","Owner":"Domestic violence support organizations, government social welfare agencies, community leaders."}]}
